title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:53 <vmassol> hi team  
09:53 <vmassol> mflorea: hi. what's the plan re the 3.0M1 release?  
09:54 <+mflorea> vmassol: sdumitriu said that he needs to fix some bugs on the blog (I think due to velocity 1.7 upgrade) and I need to fix 2 WYSIWYG bugs. Then I'll handle the selenium tests and the rest of the release.  
09:55 <vmassol> mflorea: I've been starting some profiling this morning since I was surprised by the # of calls to ECM.lookup(). Since you've been doing this too for the past few days, I'd like to sync with you on skype to share our findings. This can be done after the release though.  
09:55 <vmassol> mflorea: we need an ETA for the release. EOD today? later?  
09:57 <+mflorea> I can finish with the WYSIWYG before lunch, but I don't know how much time sdumitriu needs  
09:57 <vmassol> let's ask him when he's offline  
09:57 <+mflorea> yep  
09:57 <vmassol> we need to take into account the time we need to fix the tests too  
09:57 <+sburjan> vmassol: ATM I am testing on IE8, when I finish I will give you the link to the manual plan and digest page so devs can fix them  
09:58 <vmassol> sburjan: ok great  
10:12 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: are you around ?  
10:13 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <jstoldt> good day to you all :-D  
10:15 <vmassol> hi jstoldt  
10:16 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am trying to debug something, but it seems I am not able to find the source. I get a nasty error when uploading an attachment to a page.  
10:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <+sburjan> do we have any filters or xwiki allows all kind of extensions to be uploaded ?  
10:18 <+sburjan> I'll report it in the manual test plan  
10:25 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> sburjan: back (was otp)  
10:40 <vmassol> no you should be able to upload anything I think. What file type are you uploading?  
10:42 <vmassol> cool we're back to A rating on sonar: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/components/index/178313  
10:42 <@cjdelisle> sburjan: here  
10:42 <vmassol> http://nemo.sonarsource.org/plugins/resource/178313?page=com.sonarsource.sqale.ui.dashboard.SqaleDashboard  
10:42 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <+sburjan> with default settings I am not allowed to upload not even 10MB. I have to modify xwiki\_start.sh to increase to 1024 MB in order to work  
10:43 <vmassol> could it be my little cleaning commits that had such a dramatic impact? hmmm…. probably not… need to find why it improved  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> not allowed?  
10:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> You mean you got the "we limit you to 10 megabytes of upload" page?  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> Or did it fail with a out of memory error?  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> \*an  
10:45 <arkub> has quit  
10:46 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: I got an out of memory .. Heap Space stack trace  
10:46 <+sburjan> with   XWIKI\_OPTS=-Xmx1024m it works :)  
10:46 <+sburjan> but the default is 300 .. which seems it's not enough  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> Always worked for me up to ~30 with 512.  
10:47 <@cjdelisle> 300 should be enough but I guess it isn't.  
10:47 <+sburjan> at least on my machine  
10:47 <+sburjan> it seems it isn't  
10:47 <+sburjan> well.. at least I found out the cause  
10:47 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <vmassol> hmm seems violations dropped a lot. My guess is that they had some wrong settings somehow  
10:48 <vmassol> http://nemo.sonarsource.org/timemachine/index/178313?sid=3814730%2C12552097%2C12034058&metrics=sqale\_rating#chart\_anchor  
10:50 <vmassol> over 90 days we've increased major violations though: http://nemo.sonarsource.org/dashboard/index/178313?period=3  
10:51 <vmassol> I tink we should start enabling some findbugs rules (the most important ones)  
11:12 <jstoldt> mflorea: is there a ticket for office viewer macro failing for powerpoint files on pages that use a dash ( - ) in their name?  
11:14 <+mflorea> jstoldt: I don't think so  
11:15 <jstoldt> ok, will add  
11:15 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:24 <@cjdelisle> haha  
11:24 <@cjdelisle> I think I might have found a workaround  
11:24 <@cjdelisle> :D  
11:25 <jstoldt> XWIKI-5897  
11:32 <@cjdelisle> it builds!  
11:32 <@cjdelisle> and tests :D  
11:36 <mflorea> has quit  
11:54 <+Denis> cjdelisle: Hi Caleb, I think I have finally got it to work properly :)  
12:14 <+Denis> cjdelisle: does not seems to me that RootTransactionRunnable is usable since it will not allow any TR to execute in it except TR<void> which defeat the whole purpose of TR  
12:19 <evalica> has quit  
12:20 <@cjdelisle> Yes. rootTR needs to be fixed.  
12:21 <@cjdelisle> Anyone can declare a RT<Void> and run a rootTr inside of it so it doesn't provide any guarentee  
12:23 <+Denis> but nothing can be run in a rootTR anymore except a TR<void> and nothing else than TR<void> could be executed  in a TR<void>  
12:23 <+Denis> so there is no point to use taht  
12:24 <@cjdelisle> Making it a ProvidingTR<Void, T> would solve that problem but it can still be run inisde of a crafted TR<Void>  
12:25 <+Denis> I am also wondering the advantage we have of having multiple TR run in a TR, since chaining allow ensuring the evolution of the context, but does not implied the context should change  
12:25 <@cjdelisle> And if we move start() into TR then it will be able to be run using start(null) because null is every type.  
12:25 <+Denis> non Providing<Void, T> should not compile  
12:26 <@cjdelisle> oh right because T doesn't extend void. hmm  
12:26 <+Denis> exact  
12:26 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:26 <@cjdelisle> Maybe rootTR needs to be scrapped. It's nice to enforce that rule though since it's a common mistake.  
12:29 <@cjdelisle> Anyway, I added PTR#asProvider() and PTR#asRequirer() and made PTR<P, R> extend TR instead of TR<R> and now it works.  
12:30 <@cjdelisle> ^lol anyone not following the conversation would be all O\_o  
12:30 <+Denis> héhé  
12:30 <+Denis> but I have a PTR<R,P> extends TR<R> which works  nicely ;)  
12:31 <jstoldt> i am, thank you ;)  
12:31 <@cjdelisle> really? The test works?  
12:31 <+Denis> yes  
12:31 <+Denis> and the anti-test fails  
12:32 <@cjdelisle> I think I like this design better actually. It allowed me to remove TR#runIn(PTR)  
12:32 <@cjdelisle> so now TR only has one runIn() function.  
12:32 <+Denis> I have 2 runIn in TR but this is nice  
12:32 <@cjdelisle> the only line which changed in the test is:  
12:32 <@cjdelisle> TransactionRunnable<MyInterfaceWithDataA1> tr2WithNewCapabilities = tr2.runIn(tr1.asProvider());  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> If you want to pastebin your patch, I'll take a look.  
12:35 <@cjdelisle> Another thing I want to get to today is (IMO) a TR should not be rollback()'d unless it has been preRun() and that is not always true currently.  
12:36 <@cjdelisle> Actually (IMO) rollback only if run() was called and complete() only if preRun() was called.  
12:38 <+Denis> http://xwiki.pastebin.com/hbDz6uzS  
12:38 <+Denis> I have to go for lunch, I be back in about half an hour  
12:39 <@cjdelisle> ok  
12:40 <@cjdelisle> a haha  
12:40 <@cjdelisle> public <U extends T> TransactionRunnable<U> runIn(final ProvidingTransactionRunnable<? extends T, U> parent)  
12:41 <@cjdelisle> That makes it work but if <? extends T> then it's being used as a regular TR and not as a PTR.  
12:43 <@cjdelisle> hmm now I'm confused myself. That looks like it should be an assertion loop.  
12:43 <@cjdelisle> oh, nope  
12:44 <@cjdelisle> I think I need another test then.  
12:44 <@cjdelisle> TR<B> should be able to run inside of PTR<?, C extends B> where ? is unbounded.  
12:45 <+Denis> I do not agrre  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> It doesn't matter what the PTR requires when our TR is running inside of it.  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> We should only see it as what it provides.  
12:46 <+Denis> all context should have the same origin  
12:46 <@cjdelisle> Go ahead and have lunch, I'll commit the patch I have and we can talk about changing it later, sound good?  
12:46 <+Denis> what we try is to ensure context has mature enougth  
12:46 <+Denis> else, it is impossible to make the TR1-TR2-TR3 works properly  
12:47 <+Denis> since TR2 do not care about TR1 but the startable context  
12:48 <+Denis> so ensuring ? extends T ensure that TR2 gots what it require  
12:48 <@cjdelisle> that function says:  runIn(PTR<X extends T, Y extends T>) if both X and Y extend T then the PTR isn't being used.  
12:49 <+Denis> you have 2 cases: either you have a X extends T and return an X  or you have X extends T and an Y extends X and you return an Y  
12:50 <@cjdelisle> IDK, I have to look at it more carefully to understand why that test passes. AFAICT it shouldn't.  
12:50 <+Denis> while you are a simple TR yourself running in a PTR  
12:51 <@cjdelisle> TR<ComplexDBRunnable> should runIn() a PTR<DBRunnable, ComplexDBRunnable>  
12:52 <@cjdelisle> Thus the PTR requires a (simple) DBRunnable and provides a ComplexDBRunnable  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> But if Complex extends Simple then runIn(final ProvidingTransactionRunnable<? extends T <-- that is false.  
12:56 <@cjdelisle> I just added another test, I believe this will fail with your implementation.  
12:57 <@cjdelisle> http://xwiki.pastebin.com/BR3dRE7g  
12:57 <@cjdelisle> But it is valid because TR3 only requires what TR1 provides, TR2 is entirely extranious.  
12:57 <@cjdelisle> You'll have to remove the '.asProvider()' to use it.  
13:08 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: i want to change the style for lists in a way that page content uses different list-style-position and different margins. unfortunately, if i change .main ol, .main ul {... it messes with some of the other page elements (like the tab bar at the bottom that includes attachments, info and so forth). do you have suggestion what to add to my skin to use it just for content?  
13:12 <@sdumitriu> There's #xwikicontent  
13:12 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
13:13 <jstoldt> using #xwikicontent.main ol{... doesn't work..., it makes the content look like nothing happend  
13:15 <jstoldt> ah, deleting the .main does the trick  
13:15 <jstoldt> stupid me ;)  
13:15 <jstoldt> thanks a bunch!  
13:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:29 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <mbryant> can you place velocity code (mainly a querey) inside of a text area of a completely different object.  For example I have data that is set through a DBList, and I am trying to retrive that data  in another object.  The data structure is a Class of Person, has a dblist type of "works for".  I then have company class, with a text area property and I wanted to write the query for all the people  
13:56 <mbryant> that work at the company  
13:57 <mbryant> The reason I wanted to put it in a text area, was so that I could potientally call that property on another page, without writing the query again  
14:06 <+sburjan> cjdelisle, sdumitriu : can you recomment me a graphical text editor ? something similar to notepad++  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> What for?  
14:09 <@sdumitriu> Gnome, KDE?  
14:10 <+sburjan> Gnome  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> sburjan: gedit  
14:32 <rrodriguez> has quit  
14:32 <@cjdelisle> it has tabs across the top, syntax highlighting, converts tab key to a specified number of spaces.  
14:32 <@cjdelisle> I use it for all coding.

14:44 <venkatna> has joined #xwiki

15:05 <cjdelisle> has quit  
15:07 <jstoldt> i got an image which i want to put left to the text so the text flows on the right. problem is, the text is not just one paragraph, it's actually an unordered list  
15:08 <jstoldt> suggestions on how to achieve this? already set vertical-align and container macro won't let me change the column size to about the image width  
15:08 <user\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <vmassol> sburjan: suggestion: "Tested" as a column name doesn't show if the test was ok or not. I'd suggest "Result" and the result would be "OK" or "NOK".  
15:14 <vmassol> other suggestion: to use a spreadsheet for easier enter and filtering of data. How do OI filter the 3.0M1 test result page to show only features in error for example?  
15:14 <vmassol> (this last suggestion could be used for the next test period no need to redo now of course)  
15:14 <vmassol> looks good otherwise!  
15:14 <+sburjan> I still have some minor improvements  
15:15 <vmassol> I think you should show the tests that are tested automatically by our automated tests too so that they don't need to be executed manually  
15:16 <+sburjan> I will do that in future ... this is only the first version :P  
15:16 <vmassol> you could use "Automatic" instead of OK/NOK in the result column for example…. or something like that  
15:16 <vmassol> yep  
15:17 <vmassol> just listing ideas I got when looking at it  
15:17 <+sburjan> yepp. good suggestion.. I was thinking at this too .. to easy my manual work  
15:17 <+sburjan> ok.. updating now according to feedback :)  
15:17 <+sburjan> \*ease

15:35 <vmassol> 2011-01-18 14:33:37,145 [pool-1-thread-1] ERROR packaging.Package               - Failed to save document XWiki.ResetPassword  
15:35 <vmassol> 2011-01-18 14:33:37,209 [pool-1-thread-1] ERROR packaging.Package               - Failed to save document XWiki.ResetPasswordComplete  
15:35 <vmassol> 2011-01-18 14:33:37,426 [pool-1-thread-1] ERROR packaging.Package               - Failed to save document XWiki.ForgotUsername  
15:35 <vmassol> a pity the error doesn't provide more info....  
15:35 <vmassol> adding that info

16:06 <sburjan> has quit  
16:06 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <evalica> has quit  
16:08 <Enygma`1> has quit  
16:08 <mflorea> has quit  
16:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:46 <+sburjan> vmassol: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ManualTestPlanXE30M1  
16:46 <+sburjan> :)  
16:51 <+Denis> cjdelisle: Well, after more work, I have another implementation that match your tests without changes  
16:53 <+Denis> however it involve a abstract base class and have 4 runIn methods but fewer casts  
17:06 <vmassol> sburjan: nice  
17:19 <evalica1> has quit  
17:23 <@cjdelisle> Denis: can you paste a patch?  
17:24 <@cjdelisle> I thought about an AbstractTransactionRunnable<R, P> but I decided against it because I didn't want users to waste keystrokes always saying TR<DBTrandsaction, DBTransaction>  
17:25 <@cjdelisle> PTR serves an edge use case (IMO) so I don't like polluting the regular TR with changes required just for that.  
17:25 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:27 <@cjdelisle> I committed the change I made so you can see it in the tree.  
17:49 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:50 <sburjan> has quit  
17:50 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:50 <abusenius> has quit  
17:50 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
17:53 <npm> has quit  
18:01 <mbryant> has quit  
18:28 <+Denis> cjdelisle: my TR is still just TR<T>, but there is an underlying AbstractTR<R,P>  
18:29 <+Denis> i am just looking at the implication of this in regards to the fact that we do not have anymore a common interface to PTR and TR  
18:35 <@cjdelisle> I did something similar but scrapped it because I didn't like where it was going.  
18:36 <@cjdelisle> I had AbstractTR<R, P> at one point, I couldn't make it look good enough for me.  
18:38 <+Denis> what looks bad for you ?  
18:39 <@cjdelisle> In my implementation I didn't like the fact that everything revolved around the ptr which IMO serves an edge use case  
18:40 <@cjdelisle> Also there was the point about not having everything extend TR  
18:40 <+Denis> not sure to agree on the edge use case, since having a context is mostly useful  
18:41 <@cjdelisle> Oh, every TR will have a context according to my latest patch.  
18:41 <+Denis> without PTR, no context  
18:41 <+Denis> so PTR is not edge  
18:41 <@cjdelisle> Indeed it's not so much of an edge use case since StartableTR extends PTR  
18:42 <@cjdelisle> But I don't see people declaring or explicitly extending PTRs very often.  
18:42 <@cjdelisle> I expect it will be more of a background thing.  
18:43 <+Denis> ProvidingTransactionRunnable<Object, T> does not look good to me  
18:43 <vmassol> has quit  
18:43 <+Denis> this means startable could be runIn any other TR ?  
18:44 <@cjdelisle> That seems right to me. If it can be started manually then it needs no prior state.  
18:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:46 <@cjdelisle> I'm thinking of fixing RootTR bey extending the runIn method to throw an exception. I can't figure out how to truely prevent it running in something else at build time.  
18:46 <@cjdelisle> IMO the RootTR is a real need because most databases do not support rollback after commit.  
18:49 <+Denis> RootTR.asProvider() is useless at all  
18:49 <@cjdelisle> Do you mean RootTR.asRequirer()?  
18:50 <+Denis> no  
18:50 <+Denis> iI means TR.runin(RootTR.asProvider()) never compile  
18:51 <@cjdelisle> ahh indeed.  
18:51 <@cjdelisle> That's because I made a mistake.  
18:51 <+Denis> and using asRequirer works but is silly  
18:51 <@cjdelisle> RootTR \_was\_ correct IIRC but I changed StartableTR and broke RootTR (I think that's what happened)  
18:52 <+Denis> from our POV, for database you will need a StartableTR that do commit/rollback and also manage setting the connexion in the context  
18:52 <@cjdelisle> looks like RootTR should be RootTransactionRunnable<T> extends StartableTransactionRunnable<T>  
18:53 <@cjdelisle> And just have an exception throwing runIn method.  
18:53 <+Denis> we were also thinking that being able to do TR.startIn(StartableTR) could helps writting less 'user' code  
18:54 <+Denis> but this could also be a matter of style  
18:54 <@cjdelisle> My reasoning for wanting to separate StartableTR from TR is that allowing any TR to be started at any time by justy having the context could be dangerous.  
18:55 <@cjdelisle> null is "every type" so anyone can always call .start(null)  
18:55 <+Denis> I do not say so  
18:55 <@cjdelisle> That may be valid in some cases but others it may not and it will not be checked at compile time.  
18:55 <+Denis> TR.startIn(\_Startable\_TR) not TR  
18:56 <@cjdelisle> (that was in response to your earlier mention of merging StartableTR with TR)  
18:56 <@cjdelisle> still thinking about the implications of startIn()  
18:56 <+Denis> the may issue is how it could works, there is an issue the way it is written now  
18:56 <@cjdelisle> What did I break?  
18:57 <+Denis> since we need to run the TR.commit between lower commit and the startable commit  
18:57 <+Denis> nothing it was already like that  
18:57 <@cjdelisle> Oh re commit, I'm about to make a change to how rollback() and complete() are called.  
18:58 <@cjdelisle> I want to add the specification that if onRun() has not been called then onRollback() is guarenteed not to be called.  
18:58 <@cjdelisle> Same with onPreRun() and onComplete(0  
18:58 <@cjdelisle> that sound good?  
18:59 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:59 <@cjdelisle> I can make it less complex by using recursion too.  
19:00 <@cjdelisle> I think the use pattern should be:  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> getDoSomethingRunnable(param1, param2, param3)  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> anyone can call that function and they get a runnable which they can add to another runnable or (if allowed) start.  
19:02 <@cjdelisle> I suppose startIn() as an alias would make chaining patterns nicer.

20:57 <+sburjan`> any idea what is SQUASHFS when booting from a Live CD of Ubuntu ? I get errors (having serious problems with my PC)  
20:58 <+sburjan`> SQUASHFS error : unable to read ...  
21:00 <@cjdelisle> squashfs is a filesystem which is compressed into a zip file.  
21:00 <@cjdelisle> It's what's used for the live cd's filesystem  
21:01 <@cjdelisle> It gets pulled to ram and unsquashed and then you can use it like a regular operating system but everything is in ram.  
21:02 <@cjdelisle> And when you shutdown, any changes are gone (because they can't be written to the disk)  
21:02 <+sburjan`> I''ve tried a Fedora BOOT CD too  
21:02 <+sburjan`> same squash errors as ubuntu  
21:02 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
21:02 <+sburjan`> so it's not the defect CD  
21:03 <@cjdelisle> indeed  
21:03 <@cjdelisle> Did you write down any more of the error?
